topic.title: Working from the command area (Other Tools)

body.p: This chapter contains other tools which can be executed from the DOS command area.

contains a plugin named GUI for Command Line Tools which helps users to run the tools from within . Users are supported by displaying the command syntax as well as possible options to choose. The process and output will be same same, no matter which way the user decided to use. For more information see .

b.u: To start a task from the DOS command area:

ol.li: Type a command and its parameters into the operating system’s DOS command area (next to the command prompt) according to the command syntax described in the following chapters.

body.p: Note that lowercase letters in a parameter name are optional and need not be typed. A mixture between uppercase and lowercase letters is allowed. However, a muddled letter sequence like in OVerWRiTe must not be used. The parameters can be entered in any order.
To process several commands in sequence, type the individual commands into a DOS batch file (*.BAT using any text editor. You can execute these commands by starting the DOS batch file.

To avoid retyping of long text strings in commands, you can also type a command and its parameters in a text editor, which is capable of the Copy to clipboard function. You can then paste the text string from the clipboard directly into your system’s DOS command area and start the task.
